availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, druggist and doctor. Marion County native. Educated at St. Joseph's College. Operated Thomas E. Jenkins & Co. in Louisville, Kentucky. Partner with Dr. J. Lawrence Smith and Dr. E. R. Squib at Louisville Chemical Works. Assistant Professor of Chemistry at University of Louisville. Graduated University of Louisville Medical School in 1861.

bibl.p: Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 132. “Dr. Thomas E. Jenkins: Death of the Well-Known Scientist Last Night,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), April 21, 1879, p. 4.
